direction.raw_text: That might be difficult in this office. Bertie perches uneasily on the edge of an armchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice girl, Anna. Worried she wouldn't find a husband if she couldn't speak. Tried to convince her men will find her even more attractive as a silent partner. The perfect woman. Sorry, bad Australian joke. Why'd your wife change her mind and ask for an appointment?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't discuss that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can we talk about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's better. When speaking with a Royal one waits for the Royal to start the conversation and chose the topic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your joking. That won't work here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I admit if one waits for me to start a conversation one can wait a rather long time. Silence.   They stare at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You call this making me comfortable?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You call this being forthcoming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't you interested in treating me? TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only if you're interested in being cured. More silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cuppa tea?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need one. Turns on the hot plate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any idea what you're letting yourself in for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apparently a great deal of rudeness, Doctor Logue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me Lionel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I prefer Doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I prefer Lionel. My family calls me far worse. What shall I call you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Duke of York is appropriate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your Royal Highness then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Much more informal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prince Albert? Or Frederick? Arthur? George? I've lots of names to choose from.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about Bertie? TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (flushes) Only my family uses that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I'll call you then. We must be true equals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we were equal I wouldn't be here, I'd be at home with my family and no-one would give a damn. Bertie starts to light a cigarette from a silver case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't do that. Bertie gives him an astonished look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sucking smoke into your lungs will kill you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My physicians say it's good for stuttering, relaxes the throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're idiots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've all been knighted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Makes it official then. House rules: no smoking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought here we're "equal".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a monarchist I thought you'd appreciate these are my digs and here I rule. No smoking. What was your earliest memory?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I beg your pardon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First recollection of the world? TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stutter growing in intensity) I'm not here to discuss personal matters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why're you here then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (exploding) Because I bloody well stutter! And you bloody well can't fix it!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Temper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of my numerous faults.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you stutter when you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be ridiculous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of my many faults. How about when you talk to yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't talk to myself!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, everyone natters to themselves once in a while, Bertie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop calling me that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shan't call you anything else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we shan't speak! Silence. The jug has boiled.    Lionel makes himself a cup of tea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must I pay for this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loads. Now: when you talk to yourself, do you stutter? TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course not!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Proving your impediment isn't a permanent internal fixture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I give a speech...I bloody stutter!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bet you a bob you can read flawlessly, right here, right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bitterly) Easy money. You're on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See your shilling then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Royals don't carry money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How convenient. Logue fishes a coin from his pocket and puts it on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll stake you. Pay me back next time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there is a next time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Correct, I haven't agreed to take you on. During this, Logue has uncovered a piece of apparatus, a recording device with earphones. He sets a blank disc onto the turntable and positions a microphone, then hands Bertie an open book. Bertie glares at it defiantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I certainly can't read The Bard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `Easy money'. Bertie reads, stuttering badly and getting worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "To be or not to be, That is the question. Whether it is wiser..." There! TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not so fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I proved I can't read.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You proved you can't listen. Hands Bertie a pair of heavily padded earphones.    Bertie doesn't want to take them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A princely bob is at stake. Bertie reluctantly puts on the earphones. Logue turns a dial. LOUD MUSIC is heard. Bertie takes off the earphones. The music stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're playing music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm aware.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can I hear what I'm saying?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bertie, you're Royal. Surely a prince's brain knows what its mouth is doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not well acquainted with Royal princes, are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to demonstrate that when you can't hear your voice, you don't stutter, thus proving your impediment is not innate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rubbish. Bertie replaces the earphones. Again, the LOUD MUSIC. His lips move as he reads, but all that can be heard is the music. Finished reading the passage he takes off the earphones and the music ceases. He reaches for the coin, but Logue snatches it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was terrible. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flawless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know how I sound!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would I lie to a prince of the realm to win twelve-pence?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've no idea what an Australian might do for that sort of money. Logue puts the record in a brown paper dust jacket and hands it to Bertie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Souvenir of our first and presumably last encounter. Bertie glances at the record. POV - the label: HMV His Master's Voice. 25   INT. WAITING ROOM - DAY                                        25 Elizabeth, trying to be gracious, has been cooling her heels with a working class MOTHER and her young son WILLIE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm finished with your husband.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm finished with Doctor Logue!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lionel. They exit curtly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was that...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly not. How's it going, mate?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: William isn't trying hard enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willie? TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ddddddoooing ggggggggood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why am I not surprised? 26   INT./EXT. AUSTIN PRINCESS ON LONDON STREET - DAY               26 The Yorks are being driven home. As they pass Speakers' Corner, Oswald Mosley's blackshirt British Union of Fascists are out in full force.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bloody man did parlour tricks and cheated me out of a shilling. In fury he rolls down the window and is about to throw away the record. Elizabeth stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll see. He quickly rolls up the window. The sound of an approaching aircraft engine. 27   EXT.   PRIVATE LANDING STRIP, SANDRINGHAM ESTATE - NEW DAY     27 A grass strip cut into the moors. Bertie waits beside a shooting break, the stiff breeze whipping his coat, as a small plane lands and taxis. The cockpit canopy slides back and the pilot leaps out, removing his leather helmet and goggles, revealing hair gleaming like gold, perfect teeth flashing a dentist's smile. This is - DAVID - the Prince of Wales, Prince Charming, the media's darling, a sun god descended from the skies accustomed to being worshipped by all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, B-b-bertie. B-b-been waiting long?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three days. Where've you been? Bertie stutters badly in the presence of his brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was busy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So was I. Elizabeth has pneumonia. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll recover. Bertie shoots him a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father won't. 28   INT./EXT. SHOOTING BREAK ON SANDRINGHAM LANE - CONTINUOUS      28 David drives.   Badly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's doing this on purpose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dying?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some sod tipped him off Wallis is getting a quickie divorce and we're going to make our marriage a fait accompli. As an act of pure spite, Father's trying to depart prematurely in order to complicate matters. The break almost careens off the lane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You believe that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wallis explained it. She's terribly clever. 29   INT.   KING'S BEDROOM, SANDRINGHAM - DAY                       29 The King is propped up in bed, wrapped in his favorite faded Tibetan dressing gown, hooked to an oxygen tank. He's surrounded by his wife, Queen Mary, his two eldest sons, his Secretary - CLIVE WIGRAM - his personal physician - DR DAWSON, and a NURSE. Wigram presents a tray with papers and pen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Instruments Of Succession, Your Majesty. The King is so feeble he can barely make his mark. Glares at David.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're next? God help us. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the appropriate moment, Your Majesty. The King nods. 30   INT.   DINING HALL, SANDRINGHAM - NIGHT                        30 Clear soup is being served at the immense table.    Places set for five, but only Bertie and his mother are seated.    The clinking of silver and china. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want my jewelry divided equally. Elizabeth gets first choice. She's not greedy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I remind you, you're not the one who's dying, Mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are the others?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lord Wigram and Dr Dawson are making arrangements.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What sort of arrangements?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They didn't say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And David? Fetch him. 31   INT.   LIBRARY, SANDRINGHAM - CONTINUOUS                       31 David, hunched over a table, appears to be sobbing.     He doesn't hear Bertie's discreet knock. Seeing his brother crying, Bertie is deeply moved, puts a comforting hand on his shoulder. David pulls away as though touched by a leper and covers the receiver in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm on with Wallis! (as though Bertie didn't exist) (MORE) TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, darling, a talk, even a lovely long talk, is a poor substitute for holding tight and making drowsy. Nor making our own drowsies either, as we've had to do far too often lately. (kisses the phone) Til then, sweet love. (hangs up) Wally misses me terribly
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother says you're late for supper. David glares at a clock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clocks set five minutes in advance, so as not to be late. When I'm King I shall set them back! 32   INT.   DINING HALL, SANDRINGHAM - CONTINUOUS                  32 Bertie and David enter to find Wigram and Dawson with their mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lord Wigram has requested permission to order the coffin. Nobody wants to take responsibility. The Queen looks to David. He nods. They're interrupted by a BUTLER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Archbishop of Canterbury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the hell invited him?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody. Don't swear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody should bloody well dis-invite him. Father swears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That would be rash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not your father. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His Grace can be a persistent enemy. We need friends. David knows he's referring to the Simpson affair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show the toad in. Lang is already sweeping towards them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever can I contribute in this dreadful hour?! 33   INT.   LIBRARY, SANDRINGHAM - LATER                           33 The men are huddled, with cigars and port, composing a news release. Bertie acts as secretary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Tranquilly"? "Serenely"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peacefully. The others nod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "The King's life is moving peacefully to its..." "Termination"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...to its close."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a man of letters you're heaven-sent to assist in the editing of our press communique. Lang beams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll telephone this through to the BBC and alert The Times to hold the morning edition. The problem is...if we're to keep to schedule...time is running out. The clock is approaching midnight. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is my father late for death?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We wouldn't want the news delivered by the disreputable afternoon press, would we? The brothers look at him. He expains:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who knows what sensational side issues those tabloids might report.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps a peaceful termination? All eyes on David. 34   INT.   KING'S BEDROOM, SANDRINGHAM - NIGHT                     34 The nurse looks aghast as Dr Dawson administers an injection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three quarters of a gram of morphia and a gram of cocaine injected into the distended jugular vein.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! that's...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may leave. She does so, sobbing. Everyone watches silently as the King's breathing slows, the twitching jugular subsides, then all movement ceases. Dawson takes the pulse, and consults his watch. David sets the hand of the room's big clock back by five minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time of expiration, 11:55 pm. On schedule. Queen Mary curtsies in homage to the new King, taking her eldest son's hand and kissing it. When she looks up...her eyes are chilling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long live the King. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The look in mother's eyes, it was...ghastly. He notices something on his desk, the record Logue made. POV: the label - His Master's Voice - stares up at him. He releases his emotions in an outburst of anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this bloody thing doing here?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bertie...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man was a total fraud! He picks up the record and is about to smash it against the edge of his desk, then realizes the mess that would make and tosses it into a waste paper basket. Then changes his mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to hear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not particularly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well   I think you should. You should know what   goes on. Telling me he could help me read   flawlessly. Lying bastard! Listen to this   babble! Bertie takes the record from the trash and walks to a Victrola stand, lifts the arm, places the steel needle, expecting to hear his stuttering voice. Instead, what he hears is flawless and flowing:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "To be, or not to be, - that is the question: - Whether `tis nobler in the mind to suffer The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune, Or to take arms against a sea of troubles, And by opposing end them?" (the needle sticks) (MORE) TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "...sea of troubles, and by opposing end them? And by opposing end them? And by opposing..." Bertie lifts the needle. He and his wife stare at each other; there are tears in her eyes. The ROAR OF A HUGE delirious crowd is heard, growing in volume. The roar becomes chillingly recognizable: "Zeig Heil! Zeig Heil! Zeig Heil!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Hitler, giving one of his mass rally speeches, continues. The brass numbers 10 appears on the blackness.   It is: 36   EXT.   10 DOWNING STREET - NEW NIGHT                            36 The black front door of the Prime Minister's residence. The Fuhrer's tirade continues as CAMERA moves through the door into 10 Downing Street itself. 37   INT.   10 DOWNING STREET - CONTINUOUS                           37 CAMERA explores the dwelling, during which Hitler grows louder and more shrill, until: 38   INT.   BALDWIN'S STUDY - CONTINUOUS                             38 The glowing light of an illuminated dial of a radio, listened to by Churchill and Baldwin. They wear black armbands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn that devil off! The hysteria stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If only one could do that so easily in real life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chamberlain thinks that Hitler can be reasoned with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neville is an old woman. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the direction its going, Winston. You're out of step.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll see who trips and falls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough pleasantries. I've asked you here because you seem to be the only sensible member of the King's camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice of you to say so, Stanley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he willing to be reasonable?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Depends on the definition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has he seen the light?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has. Baldwin brightens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our Monarch basks in the warming rays of a celestial orb. Her name is Wally. Baldwin's face clouds once again. 39   INT.   LOGUE'S CONSULTATION ROOM - NEW DAY                  39 A headline screams: HITLER RATTLES SABRE. Lionel is at his desk reading the newspaper as his sons sprawl on the floor building a model airplane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mmmm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time for a Shake, dad. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shake! Shake! Shake! Clearly this is a much loved ritual. Lionel disappears into a closet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bet its the Scottish Play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Othello!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps something with Falstaff? Ominous thumps within the closet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Art thou afeard?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caliban! Lionel lumbers out of the closet, a pillow stuffed into his jacket to create a monstrous hunchback. His acting, performed just for his children, is quite magical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Be not afeard; the isle is full of noises, Sounds and sweet airs, that give delight, and hurt not. Sometimes a thousand twanging instruments Will hum about mine ears; and sometimes voices, That, if then I had waked after long sleep, Will make me sleep again: and then, in dreaming, The clouds methought would open, and show riches Ready to drop upon me; that, when I waked, I cried to dream again." The lads are enthralled. The DOOR BELL RINGS. Lionel is not expecting anyone. 40   EXT.   ENTRANCE TO LOGUE'S CHAMBERS, HARLEY STREET - DAY      40 The Austin Princess waits at the curb.    Bertie is at the door. He rings the BELL again. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor Logue? 41   INT.   LOGUE'S CONSULTATION ROOM - CONTINUOUS               41 Lionel is stunned, covers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must be a tradesman. Off you go, lads. Mum should be home from work. The boys gather their things, deposit the model plane on a chair, stow the building materials in a box, and exit the back way. Lionel goes to the door, but doesn't open it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Logue...? Logue, expressionless, doesn't respond. 42   EXT.   ENTRANCE TO LOGUE'S CHAMBERS - CONTINUOUS            42 Bertie is torn: part of him wants to flee, yet he desperately needs to be let in. He knows what must be done. This is a huge step for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lionel...it's Bertie. The door opens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My condolences. I didn't expect you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. I didn't expect to be here. May I come in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My wife doesn't think it's a good idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your wife?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Myrtle. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Myrtle? Myrtle's never met me. I've never met Myrtle. May we discuss Myrtle in private? Its not proper talking about our women on the street. Lonel gives him a look, but lets him him. 43   INT.   WAITING ROOM TO LOGUE'S CHAMBERS - CONTINUOUS          43 As they enter Bertie notices:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to your shoulder? Lionel hastily removes the pillow, tosses it away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sore back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your Myrtle got to do with me? Elizabeth doesn't much care for you either, but here I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That woman has style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which is why she dislikes you. You're far too familiar. (referring to the consultation room) May we discuss this properly? 44   INT.   LOGUE'S CONSULTATION ROOM - CONTINUOUS                 44 They enter:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look dreadful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another example of exactly the sort of thing you don't say to a Royal. And you're too close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you're not Royal in this room. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which is precisely why Elizabeth dislikes you. He starts to sit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not there! CRUNCH.   A model airplane was nestling in the armchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curtis bi-plane, now a Curtis mono-wing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh I say, I'm terribly sorry. Tell your lads I'll buy a new one. Lionel takes out the box of model building gear the boys left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have any money. I'll fix it. So, Bertie, what brings you here? Your father's death? Bertie is silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mine lay rigid, fists clenched angrily at his sides, daring the Reaper: take me, you bastard!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was he angry about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was a great disappointment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thought he'd be proud of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So did I.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man of stature?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A clerk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. (pause) (MORE) TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was informed, after the fact, my father's last words were: "Bertie has more guts than the rest of his brothers put together." (pause) Couldn't say that to my face. (then) Your mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coughed herself to death when I was young.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember going to the theatre with her. Not real theatre...traveling players.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been to Australia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not where I lived.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (blurts) My brother. That's why I'm here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going home now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must undersand, I can't puh-puh-puh... His jaw and throat muscles constrict.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try singing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pardon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know any songs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Swanee River". TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very modern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happens to be my favorite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly not. (fascinated by the plane repairs) May I help? Always wanted to build models. Father wouldn't allow it. I had to collect stamps. He collected stamps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only if you sing. Goes like this... (sings) "Way down upon the..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know the words! (sings) "Way down upon the Swanee River. ..." Etcetera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't stutter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course I didn't stutter, I was singing! One doesn't stutter when one sings! (realises) ) Oh... (then) Well I can't waltz around on State occasions warbling!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's because you're peculiar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I take that as a compliment. Cut some struts from the balsa. Sorry, hard to show you what to do at five paces. Would you like a cup of tea?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Yes. Thank you. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were about to sing an aria concerning your brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not crooning to the tune of "Swanee River!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try "Camptown Races" then. (sings) "The Arch of C, he said to me, doo-dah doo- dah..." That sort of thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't talk, or sing, about your future King, doo-dah, doo-dah...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My future King? He's your future King too. Did that cause friction? Knowing he'd grow up to be King, but you wouldn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly not. I've always looked up to David. Water's boiling. Lionel makes the pot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two lumps or one? Bertie, a bit abashed, holds up three fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've a sweet tooth. To tell the truth...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Always preferable. (referring to plane wing) Cover it with tissue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...it was a relief. Knowing I wouldn't be King.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why's that? Lionel hands him a mug of tea.   Bertie realizes it's chipped and possibly none too clean. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't have to give speeches! Reaches into his jacket for his cigarette case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No smoking. What's the age difference? While Logue isn't looking, Bertie surreptitiously wipes the rim of the mug with his handkerchief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eighteen months.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But for eighteen months you would've been King?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We didn't think about it that way, doctor. (sings) Doo-dah doo-dah. (then) David and I were very close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As you said: eighteen months.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As brothers!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How close?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Young bucks... You know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't, or I wouldn't ask. Did you go after the same girls?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Upon occasion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Princess Elizabeth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (flares) What an extraordinarily rude thing to say! (quickly under control) David did try to be her beau at one point. Before I met her. She wouldn't have him. (MORE) TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not like my father...he and his brother, when they were young, kept a girl in St John's Wood and shared her on alternate nights. An uncomfortable silence.   Too much has been said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now dope the other wing. Did David tease you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all did. "Buh-buh-buh-Bertie". Father encouraged it. "Spit it out, boy!" Thought it would make me stop. Is this necessary?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Otherwise the paint will eat through the tissue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean the damn questions!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mandatory. Tell me more about your storybook childhood. What was your earliest memory?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You asked that before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This time I'd like an answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Being born.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you remember that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: December 14th.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Mausoleum Day". Prince Albert departed on that date. I was named Bertie to placate Great Grandmamma Victoria. In return, she hated me because it reminded her of her grief. (stutter growing in intensity) (MORE) TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's stick to medical history please. I'm naturally left handed, which was considered inappropriate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was punished. Now I'm right handed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bandy legs. Also considered inappropriate. Lionel waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Metal splints were made...worn night and day...very painful. Now I have straight legs. This is so...tawdry! I need your services as a Speech Therapist, not Grand Inquisitor. Are you available? Or will it be: "Myrtle says no?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sound angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I told you, I have a temper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Angry at me, or at your brother? Bertie remains stubbornly silent.    Then blurts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's fallen in love!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How dreadful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the wrong sort of woman!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's American.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of them must be lovable. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one's divorced. Twice. Mrs Wallis Simpson of Baltimore. I want David to be happy, but the family, the Church, the nation, won't have it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't they fornicate privately like adults?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If only! David used to prefer married women because there was no possible attachment. But now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Queen Wallis of Baltimore"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does sound a bit iffy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I made a smudge!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Touch it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to beg for help?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I advise you never to beg. Especially if you might be King.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see. For reasons you cannot disclose, fearing ramifications you will not explain, you feel sufficiently anxious to embark upon a course of therapy in which you have no faith? You already owe me a shilling. Bertie takes a coin out of his pocket, hesitates, then offers it to Logue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I brought it along. You won, fair and square. I'll pay you generously. Lionel pockets the coin. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll continue to ask questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I was afraid of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (admires the plane) Nice job. Bertie sees Lionel glance at his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've someone waiting?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd apologize to them in person, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't wish to be seen? Slip out the back way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After the funeral...it may be even more difficult. To remain unobserved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're having second thoughts. Bertie's silence is confirmation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ask too many questions?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps the wrong sort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (writes an address) We live in South Kensington, small apartment, but no one would see you. (added incentive) Lots of planes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Lionel, you're the first ordinary Englishman...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Australian. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I've ever really talked to. Sometimes, when I ride through the streets and see a `bloke' I'm struck by how little I know of his life, and how little he knows of mine. Cuts both ways. As Bertie is about to leave, Lionel requests casually:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if you decide to come, bring the Duchess. She might be helpful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She might. If I asked. Very nicely. (at back door) And how will Myrtle take to our coming into your home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not sure. She isn't speaking to me. (pause) Wants to go home. (pause) After the funeral then? Bertie doesn't answer. Exits. Logue is left holding the plane. He goes to the waiting room door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How're you doing, Willie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still can't say a sentence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Iiiiiii'm much bbbbbbbetter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well done. A drum roll is heard.      Thrum.   Another...   Thrum! Thrum! 45   EXT.   ST. GEORGE'S CHAPEL, WINDSOR CASTLE - NEW DAY               45 Funereal bagpipes wail, joining the measured drum-rolls. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whereas it has pleased Almighty God to call to His mercy our late Sovereign, King George the Fifth of blessed and glorious memory... During this, INTERCUT to the REVERSE ANGLE, showing a massive military parade, mainly Navy personnel, wending its way through the main street of Windsor towards the Castle, accompanying a gun carriage on which rides the King's coffin, draped with the Royal standard, on which rests the Royal Crown topped by a Maltese Cross. David is seen - very serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...that the High and Mighty Prince Edward Albert Christian George Andrew Patrick David is now become our only lawful King. Canons are fired. Startled by the salute, a large flock of blackbirds rise up and streak across the wintery sky. A MURMUR, then a shocked GASP, as the gun carriage transverses a tram track and tilts precipitously. Suddenly the Royal Crown tumbles and falls, knocking off the Maltese Cross.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh bloody Hell!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bad omen, Your Grace? The Archbishop and Churchill are watching the events from the shadows at one end of the balcony. Below - a scramble to restore the Cross to the Crown, and replace both atop the coffin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be disingenuous. For our late King's crown to fall from his coffin is not a fortuitous portent. What ever is going to happen next? TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that be the motto of the new reign? Indeed, will there actually be "a new reign"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winston! I'm deeply shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't look it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My function requires me to appear serene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That may be increasingly difficult to maintain. I've been informed by no less an authority than the Prime Minister that our populace has no objection to Royal fornication, but will never tolerate adultery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, since we cannot acquire a new populace, perhaps we need a new King?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My turn to be profoundly shocked. Neither look the slightest traumatized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scoff, Churchill! Go on... scoff! But you more than others know full well we'll soon be under siege from the forces of darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The winds of war...a gathering storm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you do have a way with words. And who would you suggest to rally the troops, the nation, the Empire, the world? INTERCUT to Bertie in the funeral cortege, looking frail and pale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man who cannot speak? In Nuremberg stadium, Herr Hitler mesmerizes millions, whilst the Duke of York cannot successfully order fish and chips. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you prefer the next brother? INTERCUT to Henry, the Duke of Gloucester.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bi-sexual former drug addict? The unwashed moralistic populace will adore that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The youngest, perhaps? INTERCUT to George, the Duke of Kent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now there's dimness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I must admit...unburdened with brain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thus we're left with David, the rightful heir, who speaks beautifully, even if he talks nonsense. Below, the coffin is entering the Chapel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, let us bury one king, before we attempt to bring another to his knees. They exit. 46   EXT.   BUCKINGHAM PALACE - NEW DAY                            46 Re-establishing shot.   The Royal standard flies bravely. 47   INT. CONFERENCE ROOM, BUCKINGHAM PALACE - CONTINUOUS          47 Bertie waits at a table with a group of immaculately attired courtiers and dignitaries. This is the Coronation Committee. The chair at the head of the table is empty, everyone waiting for its occupant. He finally arrives. David. He gestures for Bertie to come into the corridor, but deliberately leaves the door open so the committee can hear snatches of Bertie's ensuing humiliation. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 48 David has a habit of constantly fingering his tie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hear you're taking elocution lessons, lad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pardon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diction. Speechifying. That's the word around Town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merely trying to overcome my dreadful impediment...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm the brother who speaks. Or do you wish to have a go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good lord no! I hope to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Replace me? Well...today's your chance. He thrusts a document into Bertie's hands, then pokes his head into the conference room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My brother will read the Coronation Plans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not prepared!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a Boy Scout...and you are one, aren't you, very much a Boy Scout...you must always be prepared. Nice and loud, so everyone can hear. Bertie looks at the pages, his throat constricts, his chest tightens and his hands begin to shake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I...I thu-thu-think we should tuh-tuh- table the document. He attempts to return it to David, but his brother won't accept. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell the others how Mrs Simpson is to be accommodated in a special alcove above the altar. Now I'll be off. See you at Balmoral this weekend, Buh-buh-Bertie. In the room, they are appalled. Bertie stands frozen and shattered. 49   INT/EXT. AUSTIN PRINCESS ON SOUTH KENSINGTON STREET - NEW DAY49 The lion rampant flutters on the bonnet of the Austin. Inside, Bertie, wearing a black armband, gestures for the driver to stop. Pulling his homburg over his brow, Bertie wraps his scarf around the lower portion of his face. Then catches his reflection in the rearview mirror. Tells his driver:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait down the road. 50   EXT.   SOUTH KENSINGTON STREET - CONTINUOUS                    50 Not wanting to draw attention to his destination, Bertie has disembarked several buildings away from Logue's address. He makes his way hurriedly. WACK. A soccer football hits him on the back.    He wheels around. The group of local lads look at him unabashed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kick it `ere, aye, Guv? Bertie kicks it.   A fine high shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice one. They go back to their game. Bertie rings Logue's bell. A brief pause. Bertie glances nervously, hoping not to be recognized. Lionel opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To be honest, wasn't sure whether to expect you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wasn't sure either. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something happened? Bertie stares at his mentor. Nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I look like a spy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a toothache. They disappear inside. 51   INT. STAIRWELL, LOGUE'S FLAT - CONTINUOUS                   51 Bertie has to pick his way through discarded toys and sporting equipment, explaining to Logue:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was totally unable to speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You seldom stutter with me anymore. (referring to the mess) The boys are a bit untidy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you're paid to listen!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like a verbal geisha girl? 52   INT.   LIVING AREA, LOGUE'S FLAT - CONTINUOUS               52 Bertie looks around the cluttered, but pleasant room: comfortable furniture a bit battered by the boys, antimacassars to hide the wear spots on the arms, family photos everywhere, well-used Turkish rug on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What more does a man need,eh? Lionel stares, unsure if he's being patronized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming from a man who's lived all his life in castles and palaces. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody has to live in them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody does. Ushers Bertie into his study. 53   INT. LOGUE'S STUDY - NEW DAY                               53 Bertie stands shattered, lost in his painful memory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't say anything!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could've refused. Don't you know any rude words?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a bloody stupid question! I just said one. Bloody. Bloodybloodybloody!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps a touch more vulgar?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To prove you know how.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bugger!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A public school prig could do better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well bloody bugger to you, you beastly bastard!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hardly robust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit then. Shit, shit, shit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See how defecation flows trippingly from the tongue? You don't stutter when you swear. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I'm angry!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get angry more often. Do you know the f- word?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fornication?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Bertie...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck. Fuck, fuck, fuck!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bravissimo! Now a resounding chorus of...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bloody, bloody. bloody! Shit, shit, shit! Bugger, bugger, bugger! Fuck, fuck, fuck! A pounding on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have children...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispers) This is your fault!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, pet! Won't happen again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should hope not!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apologies, Mrs. Logue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First time I've heard you laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Royals aren't allowed emotions in public.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which explains a lot. Bertie is in no mood to be provoked. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want me to do, dammit!? Stage my next public appearance as an obscene operetta?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your next public appearance should be very well rehearsed. Without thinking, Lionel instinctively reaches out to pat Bertie supportively on the shoulder. Bertie pulls back in offended shock.   All the warning signals instilled in him are going off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't take liberties! You're a dangerous man, Logue. Who sent you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyone in mind?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lurking shadows. Courtiers and peers...the whole panoply of a class which once ruled the nation which once ruled the world, afraid of losing their last vestige of privilege if the monarchy is further debased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your wife was the one who sought me out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because, dear sweet deluded woman, she believes in me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you don't share her belief? Why come here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm beginning to ask myself that very same question. Your sailing close to the edge, don't push me, Doctor Logue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lionel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came here because I was taught from childhood to serve a purpose, and that purpose is to serve. Duty is our sole justification for privilege. (MORE) TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came here because I was under the illusion you might help me perform that function!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not to worry. They say the King can do no wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can bugger things up! And I am not the King. Mrs. Simpson is seeking a divorce. The Coronation is set for the 12th of May. Her decree becomes final on the 27th of April. That gives them two weeks to marry and put this issue to rest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if Mr Baldwin stops them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That would be a tragedy. I pray to The Almighty they succeed. I'll do anything within my power to keep my brother on the throne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does that include debasing yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If necessary!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your brother knew perfectly well by giving you a document without warning...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you saying he wanted me to fail?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you insisting he didn't? In the future we can parse any document into manageable phrases. You can sing them, swear them, rehearse them til you get the rhythm and flow; that, combined with your growing confidence... Bertie doesn't want to hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Growing confidence? Growing dread!!! You're a wicked man, Lionel Logue, trying to get me to thrust myself forward as an alternative to my brother. Trying to get me to commit treason! TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trying to get you to   realize you need not be governed by fear.   Again, why did you seek me out? To take   polite elocution lessons so you could   attend posh tea parties?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How dare you! I'm the brother of a King...the son of a King...back through untold centuries. You presume to instruct me on my duty? A jumped-up jackeroo from the outback? The disappointing son of an embittered clerk! You're a monster, Doctor Logue. I'm going to Balmoral to spend a pleasant country weekend with my beloved brother. And these sessions are over! 54   INT.   STAGE OF SMALL REGIONAL THEATRE - NEW DAY             54 Closed curtains. Someone fumbles behind it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now? Lionel pushes his way through the gap in the curtain. A PROVINCIAL DIRECTOR replies from a seat in the auditorium. (Not the same Director as in the earlier audition scene.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you told? We aren't for London. Playing the provinces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outer Mongolia?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Available, are we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing prevents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe that's called "desperate for a part!" Previous experience?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Australia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have played the provinces. Righto! Let's hear what you can do. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caliban?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make him deformed. Audiences like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. (rallies himself) "Be not afeard; the isle is full of noises, Sounds and sweet airs, that give delight, and hurt not." As magical as Lionel was when he performed for his boys, here he's stiff and painfully stilted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Sometimes a thousand twanging instruments Will hum about mine ears; and sometimes voices..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you! Don't abandon your day job. Next! Logue bows his head. 55   INT. LOGUE'S DINING ROOM - NIGHT                               55 Lionel enters and sits dejectedly at the table.     Myrtle and the boys eat in silence. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haven't finished yet, Dad. (realizes) Oh! Right!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Dad. Thanks, Mum. They exit.   Myrtle knows something has happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lionel? Lionel takes five slim folders out of his jacket pocket and puts them on the table in front of Myrtle. She studies them, stunned. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 56 A woodsman's axe CHOPS into the thick trunk of a massive tree. Nearby, a bulldozer cuts into the green turf and rich soil. The felling and earth removal are being watched by Churchill and Lang from a distant terrace. In the background a jazz band in white tuxedos syncopates pertly. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five hundred year old oaks! Part of the hill! Removed to improve the view!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How ever does she do it? Inside the ballroom, seem through open French doors, an afternoon dance is being held. Churchill and Lang look in. 57   INT.   BALLROOM, BALMORAL - CONTINUOUS                       57 At the epicenter, a dashing couple: David, the very picture of insouciance, and clinging to his arm, dripping in jewelry, a rather small, angular, dark haired woman, with a high brow and square jaw - MRS WALLIS SIMPSON. Her most attractive physical feature is her back, displayed fully by a dress that plunges to her nates. Surrounded by their entourage, they are the apex of chic. Watching from the sidelines:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Erotic sexual techniques beyond polite imagination? I realize of course, that may be outside your personal experience. Winston exchanges his empty champagne flute for a full one from the tray of a passing footman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've the Devil in you today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If anyone should know, it would be Your Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All aspects of mankind are within my venue. Did you know, HM has trouble with his glands? Churchill almost chokes on his champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd not appreciated Your Grace was so well versed concerning things testicular!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were severely damaged by the measles when HM and his brother were naval cadets. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A veritable encyclopedic font of scatological information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apparently it affects the quality, although not the quantity, of HM's endeavors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the brother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unscathed. Two daughters. I shepherd my flock in all matters, Winston, including multiplication. They make their way inside. In the distance an Austin Princess can be seen making its way up the stately tree-line avenue. 58   INT.   AUSTIN PRINCESS, BALMORAL ESTATE - CONTINUOUS         58 Bertie and Elizabeth are dressed for the party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We must try to be pleasant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your father not dead six months, and That Woman throws, "A garden potty." P-o-t-t-y. She's sleeping in your mother's bedroom. And I know perfectly well she calls me `the Dowdy Duchess", and "Cookie". 59   INT.   BALLROOM, BALMORAL - DAY                              59 At the buffet table Churchill helps himself copiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has it occurred to you, as it has only occurred to me, that a Monarch with a gland problem, who realizes he cannot produce issue, might not wish to be King...? knowing his lack of issue may well become a major issue indeed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dazzling concept...beautifully phrased. A FOOTMAN announces: TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their Royal Highnesses the Duke and Duchess of York. Wallis sweeps forward to greet them, but Elizabeth sails past, announcing to no one in particular:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came at the invitation of the King. David turns and bows formally. Elizabeth cursties in return. Wallis quickly returns to David, taking him forcefully onto the dance floor. The Yorks go in the other direction. To the side, Churchill and Lang watch David and Wallis do a brisk Turkey Trot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: According to the F.B.I.... she is, after all, one of their citizens...our Monarch does not possess exclusive rights to Mrs. Simpson's sexual favours. Hitler's Ambassador, Count von Ribbentrop, has been sending her 17 carnations every day...one for each time they've slept together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good Lord, Winston, we must see to it this Empress of the Night does not become Queen of England!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vividly put. Churchill has spotted Elizabeth in a side room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allow me to test new waters. 60   INT.   PORTRAIT GALLERY, BALMORAL - CONTINUOUS                60 Churchill makes his way to Elizabeth, who is standing in front of a portrait of George IV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't need to be told I behaved badly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the contrary, Mam. Court etiquette decrees royalty must be greeted by the official host. In this case: the King. You behaved impeccably. As always. (MORE) TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (referring to the painting) A relative?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Distant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (referring again to the painting) You're well aware, of course, George IV's wife, Mrs. Fitzherbert, was very common indeed...and previously married. She signed an agreement that she could never become Queen, and their children could not be Royal. A rather sensible morganatic arrangement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was   a very long time ago. You're stirring   with a rather large spoon, Winston.   Keep in mind, I'm also a distant relative   of Lady Macbeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would disremember at my peril. David is coming briskly down the corridor, struggling to open a champagne bottle, followed by Bertie determined to catch up. Elizabeth and Churchill leave the brothers alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wally wants more champagne. I have to fetch it. She prefers that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Been trying to see you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Been terribly busy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doing what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Being King. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did you get that American accent? David...Father's not dead six months, yet you've put Mrs. Simpson in the suite used by our mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama's not still in bed, is she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That isn't funny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ssssssorry, d-d-dear b-b-oy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. No more of that. A moment of silent confrontation. David backs down. Sort of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't realize you cared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This could end in disaster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This will end splendidly. With Wallis as my wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever will she call herself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Queen of England, I suspect. Kings do marry. Empress of India. The whole bag of tricks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David! The upper classes are terrified anything which clouds the monarchy makes their situation more dangerous. Hunger marchers are singing the "Red Flag" in front of Westminster...demanding a republic...I've seen them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Herr Hitler will sort that out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who'll sort out Chancellor Hitler? TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's much maligned. By the Jews, according to Wallis. And she's very clever about politics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man's a monster! Our position must remain clear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why's that, old chap?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are a German family!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't bother anyone during WWI. And Kaiser Willie was our uncle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because we took an English name! Windsor. Because we are England. We are the heart and soul of this nation. That must never change.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you already in charge?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying to warn you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I being threatened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David, your role is to consult and to be advised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like you've studied our wretched constitution.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like you haven't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't be a lackey to an unwashed politician like Stanley Baldwin!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's your Prime Minister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I'm his King! TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you refuse to listen to our Government, they have no choice but to resign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll form another. There's Winston. He'd love to be P.M. We'll create a King's Party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To fight a general election in which your marriage is the only topic?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd risk anything and everything for Wallis. Don't I have rights?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Privileges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not the same thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yet an ordinary man may marry for love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not ordinary men, David! We were bred to be profiles on a coin. If you were ordinary, on what basis could you possibly claim to be King?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the point then? Just to look posh? You know...your speech is much improved tonight. Hardly a hesitation. Yearning for a larger audience, are we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say such a thing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is my young brother trying to push me off the throne? Sounds positively medieval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I beg of you, don't do this to my wife, my daughters, to me. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The politicians will give in. See you at my Coronation...Bertie. The champagne cork finally POPS. He strides off. 61   EXT.   10 DOWNING STREET - NEW DAY                            61 Establishing shot of the Prime Minister's residence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice of you to invite me to your digs, Stanley. 62   INT.   BALDWIN'S STUDY, 10 DOWNING STREET - DAY               62 Baldwin and Churchill are alone together.    No love lost between these two men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As you may have guessed... Churchill is silent.   Balwin waits, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I intend to resign. The Royal scandal has weakened my position considerably. Churchill, on the edge of his seat, can't suppress an anticipatory grin. Baldwin takes pleasure in deflating it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No need to volunteer your services, Winston. Neville Chamberlain will take my place, once this Royal matter is settled. As Chancellor of the Exchequer he already lives next door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My opportunity to redecorate will come soon enough, Stanley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will it? Well, enough chit-chat. The question of a morganatic marriage, as a possible solution, has been put to the Dominion Prime Ministers. After all, HM is their King too. Baldwin has a sheath of telegrams in hand. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Australia: no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David feels there aren't that many people in Australia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Canada: no. Union of South Africa: an inappropriate marriage would create a permanent wound. The Irish Free State: states it is not really their affair, and, bluntly, our English King may marry any whore he wants, they'll be well out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bloody Irish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: New Zealand...wavers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, the Kiwis!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Being rather remote, they've not even heard of Mrs Simpson. Hardly a winning hand. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not about true love, Winston. This is about who's in charge. Does the King do what he wants, or what his people want him to do? Does the King own his nation, or does the nation own their Monarch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He won't budge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nor will we. 63   INT.   PLAYROOM, YORK HOUSE - NIGHT                          63 Winston Churchill is incongruously inspecting a rocking horse. Unable to resist, he sits on it gingerly, rocking back and forth lost in a reverie. Eyes closed he extends his right arm as though holding a cavalry saber. Bertie enters startling him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't dismount. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good of you to see me at this late hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thought you were in David's camp?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was. (takes a piece of paper from his pocket and reads)

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: am now free to tell you how I was jockeyed out of the Throne."
