direction.raw_text: Good Lord! My brother wrote that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wallis wrote it for him. I'll burn it. I fear your brother is like the child in a fairy story, given everything in the world, but they forgot his soul. Quite happy to bring his nation to the brink of civil war just as we face global conflict.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not coming to that?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, there'll be war, alright. (takes out another piece of paper) Your brother held conversations with the Duke of Saxe-Coburg, your cousin, a ranking member of the Nazi party. I have the Scotland Yard intercept: "Who is King here? Baldwin or I? I myself wish to talk with Hitler, and will do so here or in Germany." I doubt England is ready to return to absolute monarchy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surely his motives are misunderstood?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "If I don't get my way, when the war comes, Hitler will crush everyone, including the Americans. The British may not want me as their King, but I'll soon be back as their leader." His intent seems crystal clear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winston?! Don't take him seriously! TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mugs for his cancelled Coronation will soon be on clearance sale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're willing to go along with this?! Changing horses in mid-stream is a perilous maneuver!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Depends how badly the horse you're on stumbles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not too late, Winston, you could form a government on his behalf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I must decline. Reluctantly. The rocking horse CRACKS.   Churchill gets to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. (starts to exit, then) I've written a new speech for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to hear it! Ever!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It does have a rather nice turn of phrase. 64   EXT.   MONTAGE OF BRITISH STREETS - DAY                      64 It is December 11th, 1936. If practical use the actual recorded broadcast (truncated). In London, Birmingham, Edinburgh, country hamlets and cathedral towns...the streets are deserted. Stragglers hurry indoors to be near: THE GLOWING DIAL OF A RADIO DAVID (V.O. RADIO FILTER) At long last I am able to say a few words of my own. Until now it has not been constitutionally possible for me to speak. A few hours ago I discharged my last duty as King and Emperor. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now that I have been succeeded by my brother, the Duke of York, my first words must be to declare my allegiance to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy, who broke our rocking horse?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A giant. Elizabeth holds a finger to her lips: shush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This has been made less difficult to me by the sure knowledge that my brother has one matchless blessing, enjoyed by so many of you, and not bestowed on me -- a happy home with his wife and children. 66   INT. LOGUE'S PARLOUR - NIGHT                                  66 The glow of a radio dial. Lionel and Myrtle sit in armchairs, the radio on a side-table between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have found it impossible to carry the heavy burden of responsibility and to discharge my duties as King as I would wish to do without the help and support of the woman I love. Lionel gets up to turn it off as David's voice concludes:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We all have a new King. I wish him and you, his people, happiness and prosperity with all my heart. God bless you all! God save the King! Logue strokes Myrtle's hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I too "married the woman I love." TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You married a shop girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wonderful lass. Someone I can talk to heart to heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Using simple words and short sentences. I'm very ordinary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why we're suited. I'm just an ordinary bloke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ordinary? You're a man with wild dreams, Lionel. Mine are so very small. A job, a husband, a home. Raising our sons. That's all I ever wanted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that why, every day, you've spent hours with a man who's about to be King?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That relationship is now past tense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yet, for as long as you could, you did what you wanted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to be a great actor. That's what I wanted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And failing that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I certainly failed!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A great healer. Always...'great'. Where does a shop girl fit in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very snugly, into my heart! Always have, always will. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trouble is, Lionel, when you say that, I still believe it. 67   INT.   INNER COURTYARD, YORK HOUSE - DAY                    67 The Royal standard on a gleaming car's bonnet. Bertie stands uneasily in the uniform of an Admiral of the Fleet as the driver opens the door. Bertie realizes its a Rolls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the Austin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Palace changed it, Your Highness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I liked the Austin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So did I, sir. The two girls wave from their open playroom window, and call:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look like a chicken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A rooster. He waves, and gets in. 68   EXT.   ST. JAMES PALACE - THAT DAY                          68 A formal voice announces:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His Majesty will address the Accession Council and take his oath. 69   INT.   ANTECHAMBER, ACCESSION COUNCIL - CONTINUOUS          69 Bertie looks at himself in a full length mirror, making last minute adjustments to his uniform. Staring at his reflection:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did this happen to you? TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 70 Bertie walks to the podium like a man to the gallows faced with an array of the Privy Councillors, members of the House of Lords, the Lord Mayor of the City of London, the Aldermen of the City of London and the High Commissioners of the Commonwealth countries. All the old symptoms reappear: the tightening of the neck muscles, the protruding Adam's apple, the jaw locking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Lords, members of the Accession Council, I meet you today in circumstances which are without parallel in the history of our Country... Its going to be a terrible performance. He bows his head in humility. And shame. 71   INT.   PLAYROOM, YORK HOUSE - THAT DAY                        71 Elizabeth is playing quietly with her daughters when the door opens and Bertie appears, still in full regalia, straight from the Accession Council. He holds his arm out, expecting them to run to him for a hug and kiss, his solace after the ordeal. They remain where they are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy's home. They curtsy formally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your Majesty. Bertie is devastated.   Elizabeth takes him quickly out into the corridor. 72   INT.   BERTIE'S STUDY, YORK HOUSE - DAY                       72 BERTIE I don't want to lose you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could you possibly?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Being what we both dread most. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dear, dear, man, I refused your first two marriage proposals because, as much as I loved you, I couldn't abide the thought of living in the Royal gilded cage. Then I realized...you stuttered so beautifully...they'd leave you alone. She takes his face in her hands tenderly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I must be Queen, I will be a good Queen. The wife of a very great King indeed. (then) You know what you must do. 73   INT.   LOGUE'S CONSULTATION ROOM & WAITING ROOM - NEW DAY     73 Logue is working with Anna. She's reading smoothly and with great intensity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Had I the heavens' embroidered cloths Enwrought with golden and silver light, The bbb..." Gets stuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We haven't much more time together. Give it a go. The doorbell RINGS.     Logue is annoyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There weren't any more appointments today. The bell RINGS again.    He yells:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Piss off! (gently) Anna?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "The blue and the dim and the dark cloths Of night and light and the half-light..." The door opens and Bertie enters the waiting area. Hearing Anna he stops outside the consultation room and listens. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "I would spread the cloths under your feet, But I, being poor, have only my dreams. I have spread my dreams under your feet; Tread softly because you tread on my dreams." Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly) Read it to him. If he doesn't profess his love, he's not a man. Anna nods earnestly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you...Lionel. She exits via the Waiting Room and almost runs into Bertie. On recognizing him, she bobs her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was lovely. Don't take any guff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I tell my Harold that's what you said?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd be honoured. She dashes off. Logue comes to the door of the Waiting Room, in effect blocking Bertie's way in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johnson, isn't it? Have you an appointment?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want me to beg?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, Kings don't beg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe this time a bit of begging might be required. Elizabeth says I must eat humble crow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Its "crow" or "humble pie". Take your pick. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was frightened and took refuge in being `Royal'. What I said was unforgivable. And...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the one essential thing a King must do? He must believe he is King. How can I possibly do that? For pity sake, Lionel, I beg you: get me through! I'll pay you another shilling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're friends for? Logue steps aside, letting Bertie in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't know. 74   INT. LOGUE BEDROOM - NIGHT                                  74 The double bed is piled high with clothing, a suitcase at its foot. Myrtle is sorting. She hears Lionel enter behind her. At first, she doesn't turn. Lionel remains silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got the boys sorting their things. Your office will be a chore... Realizing something is amiss, she turns, and knows instantly what Lionel's going to tell her. Her hand goes to her mouth to stifle her emotions. 75   INT. BERTIE'S STUDY - DAY                                   75 Bertie is with visitors: Churchill and Lang. There's a slight but discernible change in his demeanor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We asked to see Your Highness because there's the urgent question of what to call your brother. Aside from the obvious. Bertie is not pleased with His Grace's joke, but lets it pass. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you suggest?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Edward Windsor? All he deserves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What has my brother given up on his abdication, other than the throne? They look at each other, unsure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't it be a good idea to find out before coming to me? He cannot be Mister, as he was born the son of a Duke. Which makes him a Lord at the very least.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very well, Lord E.W. it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And as a Lord of the realm, he's entitled to be elected to the House of Commons. Heading a King's Party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unacceptable!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you prefer he takes a seat in the House of Lords? Again, on behalf of a King's Party? Is that acceptable?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if he's made a Royal Duke, and called His Royal Highness, he cannot stand for Parliament. Nor may he speak or vote in the House of Lords.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (realizing) Oh I say...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Duke of Windsor it is. Gentlemen. He exits abruptly. Churchill and Lang gather their things stunned. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not exactly a dummy, is he? 76   EXT.   FACADE OF D.HENRY LTD. LEATHERGOODS, KNIGHTSBRIDGE - DAY 76 Myrtle is in the shop window, arranging handbags, luggage, and briefcases. 77   INT. D.HENRY LTD. - CONTINUOUS                                77 In the store Myrtle can be seen dressing the window, while in his glass office the OWNER, a portly bald gentleman with a Dickensian air, is deep in concerned conversation with a man in trench-coat. The Owner keeps glancing worriedly in Myrtle's direction. The two men nod, shake hands. The fellow in the trench-coat leaves. The owner beckons another shop-girl over and whispers something to her. She heads towards Myrtle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Let's go gathering hearty heather with the gay brigade of grand dragons." 78   INT. LOGUE'S STUDY AND PARLOUR - DAY                          78 A wall divides the study from the living area, allowing the action in both spaces to be viewed. IN THE PARLOUR: Elizabeth waits, ill at ease. IN THE STUDY:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Splendid. Here's another. "She sifted seven thick-stalked thistles through strong thick sieves." At home, twenty-five times, in rapid succession.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those are my hardest sounds. Lionel gives him a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shall we invite your wife in now? TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wasn't expecting Myrtle for several hours! IN THE PARLOUR: Myrtle has entered, definitely unhappy. Seeing Elizabeth, she's even less happy, and flabbergasted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milady?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Your Majesty", the first time. After that, "Ma'am". Not Malm as in Palm, Mam as in ham. I'm informed your husband calls my husband Bertie and my husband calls your husband Lionel. I trust, however, you won't attempt to call me Liz. IN THE STUDY: Lionel stands listening, ear to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How're they getting on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As to be expected. IN THE PARLOUR: Myrtle announces:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may call me "Madam Logue". Myrtle's at a loss knowing what to do with a Duchess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I offer you a cup of tea, Ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Madame Logue, but I'm waiting to be summoned. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't like my husband. That's what I was told.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was told the same. IN THE STUDY: TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do we remain in hiding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going out there! IN THE PARLOUR:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you dislike about my Lionel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't wish my husband to be demeaned. What don't you like about mine?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want my Lionel getting hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's only one thing can save him now: success. IN THE STUDY: the men are growing increasingly nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're being cowards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. We're sensible men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should go in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me? You.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why me?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the Royal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Being a monarchist, I recognize these are your digs. Therefore: here you rule. Therefore: you go in. Urged by Bertie, Logue opens the door. IN THE PARLOUR: Logue enters, pretending total innocence and surprise, followed by Bertie, also trying to keep the pretense. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh! Hello, Lady Elizabeth! Oh! Hello, Myrtle darling! What a pleasant surprise. Myrtle stares at him and takes her revenge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will the Yorks be staying for dinner? Logue and Bertie look panic-stricken.   Elizabeth comes to the rescue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A previous engagement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some other time, love. Logue ushers Elizabeth into the study, giving Myrtle a nervous little wave. She glares and exits. IN THE STUDY:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glad you had a chance to meet Myrtle. Bertie stifles a snort. Elizabeth glares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Elizabeth) Good of you to come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harley Street is far too public. What is my function here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For me to show you how to pitch in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh dear, I may not be a `pitch in' type.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Piece of cake. (to Bertie) Please assume a supine position on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Firm support is needed. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Breathe deeply...expand your chest... now your stomach...deep into the diaphragm. Splendid. How do you feel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Full of hot air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well on your way to becoming a qualified political speaker. Again... Bertie inhales deeply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and hold. Now, Princess Elizabeth, be so kind as to sit on your husband's stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good grief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gently of course. Elizabeth sits gingerly on Bertie's stomach, asking solicitously:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you alright, Bertie? Bertie nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now exhale slowly...down goes Princess Elizabeth...inhale slowly...nothing rushed, expanding your chest fully, extending the column of air til it hits the diaphragm...and...up comes Princess Elizabeth. Exhale...down goes Princess Elizabeth...inhale...up comes Princess Elizabeth. You get the idea. Doesn't have to be Princess Elizabeth of course, but I thought you'd prefer your wife to one of the staff. Now comes the fun part.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's actually more? Bertie springs to his feet while Logue opens a window. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will now shout the vowel sounds, all five of them, as loudly as possible, each to last no less than 15 seconds. There's poor coordination between your larynx and diaphragm. Princess Elizabeth, you can be the official timer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vowel sounds? Shouted at an open window? On a public street?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyone who can stand at an open window vibrating loudly in full view of the world can learn to give a public speech.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They can also be considered quite dotty. Don't even contemplate it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, dear, doctor's orders. Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa... (stops) She's right, those two chaps are staring at me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're always looking at you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're followed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Royal scrutiny, Doctor, best get used to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaayyyyyyyyyyy... ...eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee... (to Elizabeth) Are you timing this? iiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiii... ooooooooooooooooooooooooo... uuuuuuuuuuu. 79   INT.   LOGUE'S DINING ROOM - LATER                            79 The family eat in tense silence TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May we be excused?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. The unhappy meal continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mumbles) We don't want to hear you fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not fighting. Your mother isn't talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wish me to speak my mind?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boys, leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Dad! Thank you, Mum! They exit hurriedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lionel...without warning, I arrive home to find the Queen in my parlour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duchess, she hasn't been crowned yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lionel, don't quibble!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you think of her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does it matter!? She's the Queen and he's the King forgodsake! What're they doing here?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd you come home so early?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lionel...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They came for help. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What role are you auditioning for now? Royal saviour?! Who's going to help us?! This will bring us down, Lionel. You know it will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When that poor chap first walked into my office, he was a slim, quiet man with tired eyes and all the outward symptoms of the person upon whom a habitual speech defect has set the sign. You saw him today; once more there was hope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not listening to me! She gets up angrily and starts carrying dishes to the kitchen. He follows her back and forth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Myrtle, I love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You say that, but you don't listen when I say, in so many ways, how desperately I want to go home, how I never, ever, intended to stay here. This was to be a holiday trip to see `Mother England', and you turned it into quite something else. What happened, Lionel? We went to Wembley Stadium, next thing...you'd cashed in our tickets. He's silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very well, I shan't talk of this ever again. I will, as always, be supportive of your endeavours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Myrtle... I don't deserve a wonderful woman like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How right you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But why'd you come home so early?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lionel...I was let go. TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inquiries were made...Mr Falkoff wouldn't say who...afterwards it was: `With your hubby treating a personage that high and mighty, you won't be needing employment with us, will you, Mrs Logue?'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're frightened, Lionel. Of what seems so far above them. I sympathize. I'm frightened too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Myrtle. My love... 80   WESTMINSTER ABBEY - NEW DAY                                 80 Establishing shot of this architectural icon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winston, you do read the newspapers? 81   INT.   WESTMINSTER ABBEY - DAY                              81 A massive cavern of stone statuary and stained glass. The center piece of this particular section is the throne of Edward the Confessor. Scaffolding is in the process of being erected to supply lighting for the Coronation. Archbishop Lang and Churchill inspect it with satisfaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only the vulgar ones. Churchill pours two nips of whiskey into metal cups nested in a hip flask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To our new King.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's sincerely hope. They look at each other in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this a `slightly pregnant pause'? TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say he is dim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Demonstrably untrue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say he has epilepsy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Patently erroneous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fragile, prone to illness...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some correctness in that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and will die prematurely. They predict he'll be unable to complete the Coronation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you propose? Shorten the ceremony? Or no ceremony at all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My idea exactly!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believed so. But what we need is a pageant of pomp and pomposity to impress the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What we need, and what we'll get, may be two rather different things. Did you hear his pathetic attempt at the Accession Council? He'll never be able to speak in public.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, we plonk a tinsel crown on his head and lock him in a closet? Who then will spiritually lead this great nation into war? Who will address the far flung corners of the Empire, rallying all to our defense?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Head of our Church? Is that what you have in mind? TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would it be such a calamity?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Best ask our new King. Bertie has entered with Logue. Lang spins around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your Majesty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, sir, duty calls. He exits quickly. Cosmo continues nervously as they walk through the Abbey, the Archbishop pointing out the preparations in progress, particularly a booth for broadcasters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this the scene of the crime?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a peculiar thing to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Referring to my assault upon the ears of the listeners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, yes, wireless is indeed a Pandora's Box. I have, however, categorically said no to the BBC's new "radio-with-pictures" gadget. Imagine, the unwashed viewing us as we blow our noses or scratch our bottoms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Radio with pictures?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is called..."television". Happily, with a transmission range of only fifteen miles this "TV" thing has no future. We shall, however, be forced to permit cinema; the product of which I shall personally edit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That'll keep you busy, removing all my stops and starts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless of course you'd prefer a quiet ceremony? TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What exactly do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something...discreet...private. We could pre-record an edited version to be broadcast to the world. Or even find an actor with a similar voice. Logue has arrived and comes out of the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: King based upon deception? Cosmo takes Bertie aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If your gentleman from Security would give us space, we could discuss this in private.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean my bodyguard,"Crusher?" Giving Lionel a scathing look, Lang continues speaking to Bertie confidentially.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fret not. As I assured our nation in my recent broadcast: "When his people listen to their new Monarch they will note an occasional momentary hesitation in his speech. But to those who hear it, it need cause no sort of embarrassment, for it causes none to him who speaks." You see, I've paved the way. But should you wish to avoid further stress...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not paint him pink and cover him with sequins?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pardon?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you wish to call attention to his anxiety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does your bodyguard know to whom he's speaking? He certainly doesn't know his place! TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor Lionel Logue, my speech therapist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Therapist?! I'd no idea! Had I known Your Majesty was seeking assistance I would've made my own recommendation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Logue is to be present at the Coronation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Impossibly to find room. Even for a Doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just Lionel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind the chair of Edward the Confessor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Royal Box!? Your Family will be seated there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which makes it most suitable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps I might be able to add a very small stool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two comfortable chairs. One for Madam Logue. She's a close friend of my wife. The Queen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll have someone attend to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now, if you don't mind, we need the premises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My dear fellow, this is Westminster Abbey! The Church must make preparations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So must Bertie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bertie?! We do not call the King: "Bertie"! TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do. During waking hours we'll need the facilities. It'll be a closed set. No observers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those are my wishes, Your Grace. Lang nods curtly and exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've made a dangerous enemy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't want him as a friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And don't ever call me Bertie in public. A moment of confrontation.    Lionel knows he's overstepped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sense one of your dreadful questions on the horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you really want to be King?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Knew it! I haven't any choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can be a wounded King who stumbles through his Coronation. Or, as the Arch of C so archly suggests, no Coronation at all. Always a choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this, you wait til Westminster Abbey, then ambush me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm simply asking questions... which you seem unable to answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a sacrificial lamb being led to slaughter! Damn you! TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quite possibly. But at least I know what I want. You haven't the foggiest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (explodes)
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE GLOWING DIAL OF A RADIO DAVID

dialogue.raw_text: . 65   INT.   PLAYROOM, YORK HOUSE - CONTINUOUS                      65 Bertie and Elizabeth listening to the radio with the two princesses royal sitting at their parents' feet. Bertie battles his emotions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . Logue goes to the door and starts to open it. He shuts it quickly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . Bertie dutifully lies on the floor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! His words reverberate through the empty abbey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's quite different. Let's get down to work then, shall we? Bertie glares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As soon as you and Elizabeth enter the West door, you'll be greeted with the hymn "I Was Glad When They Said Unto Me." You won't actually be that glad, because they sing it for a great long time. Bertie follows Logue deep into the bowels of the `Abbey'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll then show yourself to the various sides of the Abbey as the Archbishop announces four times in a loud voice, "Sirs, I here present unto you..." Have you decided your name for when you become King? For when you become a different person?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like your father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like my father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not Albert?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Given the current situation...too Germanic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Sirs, I here present unto you, GEORGE, your undoubted King!" TKS/Seidler/09/17/08
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . "George, your undoubted King!" echoes through the Abby.
dialogue.name: dialogue
